question: You were doing a short course at another country. All of a sudden, you had to leave the course and fly back to your home country. Write a letter to your teacher, and in your letter– express your gratitude– explain why you had to leave– explain what part of the course you enjoyed the most
text: First of all, I have to apologize for my short notice about windrow the course. I am writing this letter to explain the reason why I cannot continue the session.
I have really enjoyed your class, especially your teaching method and your friendly character. I appreciated your dedication and always helpful Teacher I would definitely miss you so much.

Regarding the job offering letter from the UN in the Thailand branch. The position they are offering is my dream work that I have always been desiring and enthusiastic  to work in my life.  This task not only requires  skill and knowledge but it is also physical work from time to time as it is required to travel to a remote area to visit and do an observation of The poor children. Therefore, I decided to cancel the course in order to work and help those kids to have a decent living standard like proper education.

There is no doubt deniable that attending your class even though it is an incomplete course. I have gained a lot of  knowledge while studying. Particularly, the presentation in front of classmates  really improved my public speaking. I would say this is the most useful and I can adapt it in my real life.
I look forward to seeing your response.
